description: We need to survey the base site first.
The first thing we are going to need is a command tent to manage and task workers from.
We're going to need a fire pit and a bed if we want to stay here permanently.
To make this outpost functional we are going to need storage containers to organize our supplies.
Next we should expand the camp to comfortably support two people indefinitely.
Additional housing and storage will allow our camp to expand into specialized industries.
Constructing a hard command post will transform our little camp into a true base.
Building additional housing will allow us to send companions out to find recruits.
We need to expand our base to include basic dining facilities.
More housing means that we can support additional specialists.
An expanded kitchen is needed to support our growing settlement.
Finishing the hard structure will give us a more secure place to retreat to if we come under attack.
I'm surprised we've made it this long without securing a clean water source, we need a well.
Building a strong wall will keep the base secure even if a small horde attacks.
We need to finish our half built fortifications.
We're running out of room and need another living quarters.
Our kitchen isn't able to keep up with demand, we need to expand it.
We should build stronger doors to secure our compound.
One more tent and our living space will be full.
We could construct a radio tower to improve communication range, first step is the tower structure.
We need to build a console to control the radio tower.
Survey land for a farm shop.
Plowing a few plots should get us started.
We could use a farming shed to store resources where we'll be working.
Our farm could be expanded by finishing the shed and adding additional plots.
Building a processing shack should allow us to reclaim additional seeds from our byproducts.
//: 1hrs*26wall + 1.5 hr*1door + 0.5hrs*14pits + 2hrs*2window + 2hrs*20log roof + 0.5hrs*9counter + 0.5hrs*1table = 83.5 hrs (12hrs on/off) 7 days total; requires 26wall*(2log+3stick+6 2x4 ) + 1door*(16 2x4+36nail) + 2windows*(15 2x4+30nail+2log+glass) + 20roof*(2log+4stick+8 2x4) + 1table*(8nail+6 2x4) + 9counter*(8nail+6 2x4)

description: Survey land for a garage.
Building a tool rack should be the first priority.
We should start construction of a roof for the garage.
Finishing out the roof will let our mechanics work rain or shine.
Our garage isn't big enough to work on larger vehicles.  Let's start expanding it.
Finishing the roof will let us park RVs and buses in the garage.
Attaching quarters will let our mechanics work longer hours when needed.
Survey land for a kitchen.
Building a cook-shack is our first task.
We need to finish framing the walls for the cook-shack.
Expanding the shack by including a smoker will increase our versatility.
A pantry will allow our cooks to store more non-perishables.
Increasing our number of smoking racks will let us craft larger batches.
A well is needed so our cooks don't have to haul in water.
Wood stoves will give us greater control of temperatures and let us craft more difficult recipes.
Finally, expanding the pantry further will let us store additional materials.
A trench that may deter movement but is meant to be the foundation of a picket or palisade.  Requirements are for 1/2 an over map tile.
A deep trench filled with spikes, requires a trench.  Requirements are for 1/2 an over map tile.
Survey land for a blacksmith shop.
Building a forge and kiln is our first task.
Building a proper roof for the shop is the next step.
Building a working table and placing an anvil are next.
If we're going to do more than simple metal casting we need a bigger shop.
We need some basic tools to make more advanced crafts.
An expanded forge will allow us to work on bigger projects.
Proper steel work requires a bellows and quenching setup.
A separate workshop will allow us to do the most basic of machining.
Next we need to add some basic tools and vises to the workshop.
Advanced forging processes require more room to work.
An on-site well will allow us to fill boilers as needed.
A steam-powered drop hammer will greatly increase production speed in exchange for charcoal.
